item.title: Discriminant Functions and Decision Boundary
item.description: Preliminaries convex definition linear algebra vector length vector direction Discriminant Function in Classification The discriminant function or discriminant model is on the other side of the generative model. And we, here, have a look at the behavior of the discriminant function in linear classification.1 In the post ‘Least Squares Classification’, we have seen, in a linear classification task, the decision boundary is a line or hyperplane by which we separate two classes.
